snippet: Sunni militants in Iraq are rounding up former government workers, allowing some to repent and live while executing others, residents and a United Nations official said.
abstract: Sunni militants aligned with Islamic State in Iraq and Syria have begun seeking out citizens in Mosul, Iraq, who worked for the government, offering some a chance to repent and live under their authority, and executing others on the spot.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and NICK CUMMING-BRUCE
byline.contributor: Tim Arango reported from Erbil, and Nick Cumming-Bruce from Geneva.

lead_paragraph: Sunni militants in Iraq are rounding up former government workers, allowing some to repent and live while executing others, residents and a United Nations official said.

headline.main: Reprisal Killings Reported in Iraq’s Militant-Held Areas
headline.print_headline: Reprisal Killings of Iraq Government Workers Are Reported in Militant-Held Areas

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
